description.narrative:
Project level impact: - Supporting gender finance: MBK currently has 1 million women borrowers. Through this project IFC anticipates that MBK would reach additional low-income women borrowers particularly in rural areas through the provision of working capital financing. - Job creation particularly for women: MBK employs over 4,000 people of which 99 percent are women. The project is expected to create 3,000 further job opportunities for women as the proposed funding will facilitate outreach expansion through deployment of additional human resources. Furthermore, there may be additional job effects at the women owned microenterprise level.
Market level impact: - Inclusiveness: MBK is a leading MFI in Indonesia with predominantly women clients. IFC anticipates that the project will increase access to products and services for under-served low-income women borrowers particularly in rural areas of Indonesia. It has been in operations since 2003 and its successful track record can positively contribute to the adoption of impact business models through replication.
